Justification: To check for any signs of infection, glucose, or other abnormalities in the urine that could contribute to bedwetting.

Investigation: Ultrasound of the kidneys and bladder
Justification: To rule out any anatomical abnormalities or issues with the urinary tract that may be causing bedwetting.
To track fluid intake, urination patterns, and bedwetting episodes over a period of time to identify any patterns or triggers.
To evaluate if there are any daytime urinary issues that may be related to the bedwetting.
To explore any emotional or psychological factors, especially related to the recent change in school, that may be contributing to the bedwetting.
